arm_group.arm_group_label: multiparas having a planned cesarean section

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of the study is to evaluate whether outpatient cesarean section can be performed
      in multiparous women without significant decrease in the parents' sense of security .

clinical_study.brief_title: Outpatient Care for Multiparas After Elective Cesarean Section: an Observational Study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Planned elective cesarean section of multiparous women

          -  Singleton pregnancy

          -  Age of at least 18

          -  Gestational age between 37 and 42 weeks

          -  Internet access at home

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Lack of consent

          -  Women with no or little understanding of Danish and ability to speak Danish.

          -  Allergies to medicine included in the pain management regimes

          -  Expected maternal or neonatal complications after delivery

          -  Birth weight of less than 2500 grams

study_pop.textblock: multiparas having a elective cesarean section at Herning hospital

facility.name: Department of gynaecology and obstetrics, Herning Hospital

primary_outcome.description: measured by a questionnaire sent to the parents' in the second week after delivery.
primary_outcome.measure: the parents' postnatal sense of security (PPSS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: the PPSS is measured the second week after delivery

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: ambulation time measured during the first three days after delivery by an accelerometer

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
